questions.question: I don't mind getting ................................ early if there is a good reason to.
questions.description: To get up is to rise from bed after sleeping.

questions.question: There is no room on the bus. Let's get ..................................... again.
questions.description: To get off a vehicle is to leave a vehicle.

questions.question: Get ..................................... and I will drive you to the station.
It took me a long time to get ......................................... the disappointment.
questions.description: To get over is to overcome a difficulty.

questions.question: The robbers got ...................................... with diamonds worth millions of dollars.
questions.description: To get away is to escape.

questions.question: The supervisor asked the employees to get ............................................... the job quickly.
questions.description: To get on with work is to perform work.

questions.question: I tried calling but I couldn't get ............................................ to him.
questions.description: To get through to somebody is to be able to talk to them via telephone.

questions.question: I find it very difficult to get .......................................... on my meager salary.
questions.description: To get by is to manage to live with great difficulty.

questions.question: The setbacks got him ........................................
questions.description: If something gets you down, it makes you very unhappy.

questions.question: Can we get ........................................ for lunch on the weekend?
Rumors get ....................................... fast.
questions.description: When rumors get around, they spread.
